clinical_study.brief_title: Two-stent vs Provisional Stenting Techniques for Patients With Complex Coronary Bifurcation Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multi-center, Randomized Trial Comparing Two-stent With Provisional Stenting Techniques for Patients With Complex Coronary Bifurcation Lesions

lead_sponsor.agency: Nanjing First Hospital, Nanjing Medical University

clinical_study.source: Nanjing First Hospital, Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to establish the optimal strategy for stenting in coronary bifurcation lesion.

detailed_description.textblock: The current study is designed as a multicenter, randomized and prospective study aiming to compare the effect of two-stenting and simple stenting techniques in patients with complex bifurcation lesions. Based on the previous studies, the rate of 1-year target lesion failure events was around 25% after PCI with provisional stenting. And our previous data showed that this event at 12-month after DK crush procedure was 15%. Considering the lost to follow-up, it is anticipated that up to 660 patients will be enrolled in the trial. All patients will have repeat angiography at 13 months, with clinical follow-up to 5 years.

primary_outcome.description: Combined end point of: cardiac death, target-vessel myocardial infarction (MI), or ischemia-driven target lesion revascularization (TLR).

secondary_outcome.description: Combined end point of: cardiac death, target-vessel myocardial infarction (MI), or ischemia-driven target lesion revascularization (TLR).

other_outcome.description: In-stent restenosis was defined as ≥50% diameter stenosis at the follow-up angiogram.
The late lumen loss was defined as the difference between post- and follow-up minimal lumen diameter (MLD)
The acute gain was defined as the difference between post- and preprocedural minimal lumen diameter (MLD)

arm_group.description: Percutaneous coronary intervention with DK crush, or culotte, or provisional T stenting technique
Percutaneous coronary intervention with simple stenting technique

intervention.other_name: DK crush, culotte, provisional T stenting

intervention.description: Stenting of the side branch in the simple stenting group was required if TIMI flow was <3, or presence of type B dissection or greater after kissing balloon inflation.
